description: This is the GLES equivalent of GL_MESA_pack_invert.

title: cogl: Remove reference to nonexistent type CoglVertex2f
description: It is actually CoglVertexP2.

title: cogl: Remove unused explicit blend-enable controls
GLX and X11 header cleanup
description: Shuffles some glx-specific headers into the winsys to hide them from the cogl core, and deletes some unnecessary GLX and X11 includes where possible. No functional change.

title: screen-cast: Fix window recording on HiDPI
description:
Using the same scale for the window as the
logical monitor only works correctly when having
the experimental 'scale-monitor-framebuffer'
feature enabled.
Without this experimental feature, the stream
will contain a black screen, where the actual
window only takes a small part of it.

Therefore, use a scale of 1 for the non-
experimental case.

Patch is based on commit 3fa6a92cc5dda6ab3939c3e982185f6caf453360.

Here is a visualization of the problem using a maximized firefox window: Without this MR:  
![before](/uploads/0ff57cf88e59f7ee32ab8ff6a09040e7/before.png)  
With this MR:  
![after](/uploads/1217230250ea29f6d869a4a94346b826/after.png)

title: core: Let pad mode switch events always go through MetaInputSettings
description:
We used to inhibit all pad actions while the OSD is shown, but one we
would actually want to handle are mode switches while the OSD is open.
So it has an opportunity to catch up to the mode switch.

This lets MetaInputSettings reflect the mode switch (eg. when querying
action labels), so the OSD has an opportunity to update the current
actions.

title: backends/native: Get the correct value for pinch dy
description:
The code currently sends the value of `dx` for both `dy` and `dx` in pinch gestures. This looks like a typo, so fix it.

The bug dates back to 2015, it probably went unnoticed because there is currently no easy way to get these values from GTK.

Fixes #972

title: cogl: Add and use driver context init/fini hooks
description: This continues the effort to move all explicit GL awareness out of cogl core and into the driver. We add driver hooks for cogl context setup and teardown, and move the direct GL calls into there from `cogl_context_new`. Having done that we can remove some not-especially-useful private feature flags.

title: backends: Consider pen/eraser devices when looking for matching WacomDevice
description:
Those device types are still in use through the X11 backend, breaking some
checks around on that backend...

title: backends: Check both input settings and mapper for tablet monitors
description:
The upper layers (OSDs basically) want to know the monitor that a
tablet is currently assigned to, not the monitor just as configured
through settings.

This broke proper OSD positioning for display-attached tablets since
commit 87858a4e01d9, as the MetaInputMapper kicks in precisely when
there is no configured monitor for the given device.

Consulting both about the assigned output will make OSDs pop up
again in the right place.

title: backends/x11: Observe multiple pad mode switch buttons in a group
description:
Some tablets like the Cintiq 24HDT have several mode switch buttons
per group. Those are meant to jump straight to a given mode, however
we just handle cycling across modes (as most other tablets have a
single mode switch button per group).

So spice up the mode switch handling so we handle multiple mode
switch buttons, assigning each of them a mode. If the device only
has one mode switch button, we do the old-fashioned cycling.

title: Batch clip rectangles into a single upload
description:
For the fastest possible upload of those rectangles.

In the case of the Gnome Shell icon spring animation this eliminates most of the performance regression compared to scissoring.

Closes: #971

title: backends: Always enable tap-to-click/drag on opaque Wacom tablets
description:
Touch-wise, those are essentially giant touchpads, but have no buttons
associated to the "touchpad" device (There may be pad buttons, but
those are not mouse buttons).

Without tap-to-click/drag, touch in those devices is somewhat useless
out of the box. Have them always enable these features, despite the
setting.

title: ci: Always generate a machine ID
description:
NOTE: This should be cherry-picked to gnome-3-34. master currently does not need this, but it is a good idea either way.

At least the F30 base image does not seem to ship with a machine-id.
This causes tests that require DBus to fail as the dbus daemon cannot be
started.

title: ci: Add note that podman needs --format docker
description:
Without this podman will create images that work on some–but not
all–runners. Just adding --format docker will make the created images
work in all cases.

title: clutter-timeline: Fix some indentation
description:
In Gnome Builder this looks very odd, much worse than in git.
We'll probably not touch the code soon, so fix indentation
for better readability.

title: xwayland: Don't queue frame callbacks when role assigned
description:
'xwayland: Do not queue frame callbacks unconditionally' changed the
frame callback behavior of Xwayland surfaces so that they behave the
same way as other actor surfaces (e.g. xdg-shell ones), except for the
case when they are initially assigned.

Remove this special casing as well including the now incorrect comment,
so that the Xwayland surfaces behave the same as the others in this
regard also when assigning.

title: backends/native: Fix relative motion calculation if monitor isn't found
description:
The method `relative_motion_across_outputs` is used to adjust the
distance/delta of a mouse movement across multiple monitors to take the
different scale factors of those monitors into account. This works by
getting the adjacent monitors that the movement-line/vector intersects
with and adjusting the final position (or end point of the
movement-line) by multiplying the parts of the line spanning across
different monitors with the scale factors of those monitors.

In the end of this calculation, we always want to set the new end
coordinates of the relative motion to the new end coordinates of the
adjusted movement-line. We currently only do that if all adjacent
monitors the line is crossing actually exist, because only then we end
up inside the "We reached the dest logical monitor" else-block and set
`x` and `y` to the correct values. Fix that and make sure the returned
values are also correct in case an adjacent monitor doesn't exist by
adding separate `final_x` and `final_y` variables which we update during
each pass of the while loop so we're always prepared for the while loop
exiting before the destination monitor was found.

Thanks to @axkibe for reporting the initial bug and tracking
the issue down to `relative_motion_across_outputs`.

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/issues/774

title: core/keybindings: fix center window position #964
description:
Let `move-to-center` window position same as `center-new-windows`.
The position are based on `logical_monitor`.

Fix #964

title: Wayland wl_subsurface fixes
description: This MR fixes two issues, one harmless runtime warning, and a crash. While at it it adds a test for the crash.

title: backends/native: Fix double free of error
description:
error is an autoptr, so must not be explicitly freed.

Fixes: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1852

Fixes: 5c500ad402194 ("backend: Move GPU ownership from the monitor manager to the backend")

title: Accel fixes
description:
When creating a new config because of a monitor being (un)plugged or
because of super+p being pressed, honor the orientation reported by
the accelerometer for the internal panel.

Before these changes we would always configure the internal panel with
a normal / upright transform when e.g. an external monitor gets plugged
in even if another transform was in use before plugging in the external
monitor. This is inconsistent and causes problems for several use-cases.
This commit fixes this by querying the accelerometer when creating a new
config for an internal panel.

Fixes: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/issues/707
Fixes: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/issues/924

title: startup: Fix build with 'startup_notification=false'
description: Prevent access to data structures and functions related to startup notification if building with `-Dstartup_notification=false`.

title: build: ensure absolute path to sysprof dbus interface dir
description:
We want sysprof's exact datadir for compatability with
platforms where software is installed into their own
individual immutable prefix's. Such that, mutter's prefix will
never equate to sysprof's. This depends on a MR in sysprof [0]
which adds datadir to its pkgconfig files, as these files will always
have the proper path we want.

[0]: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/sysprof/merge_requests/19

title: xwayland: Do not queue frame callbacks unconditionally
description:
The removed comment is not longer true: XWayland schedules its VSYNC
from frame callbacks nowadays. Only sending callbacks when the surface
actor is unobscured makes XWayland throttle its VSYNC to 1/sec,
reducing repaints in many cases.

Follow up of https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/merge_requests/918

**Note:** While this is not expected to regress XWayland client behaviour, *if* it does we should fix that in XWayland. Wayland compositors should not be expected to send frame callbacks if not appropriate.

---

How to test:
- apply https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xorg/xserver/merge_requests/356 to XWayland
- open a terminal
- run `glxgears`
- hide `glxgears` behind the terminal

Expected result:
- frames should drop to 1/sec

title: Expose push and pop framebuffer in ClutterPaintContext
description:
When rendering on-stage, it might be necessary to push offscreen
framebuffers to the paint context by external consumers, such as
GNOME Shell effects.

Expose clutter_paint_context_push|pop_framebuffer().

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/merge_requests/955

title: xwayland: Don't use abstract socket on non-Linux systems
description:
Abstract socket is a Linux-only feature. On operating systems other than
Linux, we can only use the normal UNIX socket.

This patch allows mutter to run as a nested Wayland compositor under
Xorg on FreeBSD.

title: Fix KMS freeze after pageflip fallback
description:
A complete GNOME/Wayland desktop freeze has been observed of Ubuntu 19.10 a split second after hotplugging and taking into use a DisplayLink dock (v3) with proprietary DisplayLink userspace driver. The freeze is not deterministic, but it is fairly easy to reproduce on an empty desktop on the first hotplug of the dock after reboot.

The backtrace of the freeze:
```
#0  0x00007feccd338c2f in __GI___poll (fds=fds@entry=0x7ffd81b5cd38, nfds=nfds@entry=1, timeout=timeout@entry=-1) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/poll.c:29
#1  0x00007feccd53ff8a in poll (__timeout=-1, __nfds=1, __fds=0x7ffd81b5cd38) at /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/poll2.h:46
#2  0x00007feccd53ff8a in meta_kms_impl_device_dispatch (impl_device=0x56520b18e630 [MetaKmsImplDevice], error=0x7ffd81b5ce68)
    at ../src/backends/native/meta-kms-impl-device.c:126
#3  0x00007feccd543516 in meta_kms_run_impl_task_sync
    (kms=0x7fecbc007060 [MetaKms], func=func@entry=0x7feccd53f5c0 <dispatch_in_impl>, user_data=<optimised out>, error=error@entry=0x7ffd81b5ce68)
    at ../src/backends/native/meta-kms.c:343
#4  0x00007feccd53fa27 in meta_kms_device_dispatch_sync (device=0x56520b69f140 [MetaKmsDevice], error=error@entry=0x7ffd81b5ce68)
    at ../src/backends/native/meta-kms-device.c:162
#5  0x00007feccd533521 in meta_gpu_kms_wait_for_flip (gpu_kms=<optimised out>, error=error@entry=0x7ffd81b5ce68) at ../src/backends/native/meta-gpu-kms.c:114
#6  0x00007feccd53a605 in wait_for_pending_flips (onscreen=0x565209b94800) at ../src/backends/native/meta-renderer-native.c:1751
#7  0x00007feccd53a605 in meta_onscreen_native_swap_buffers_with_damage (onscreen=0x565209b94800, rectangles=0x7ffd81b5d000, n_rectangles=0)
    at ../src/backends/native/meta-renderer-native.c:2212
#8  0x00007fecccf393ae in cogl_onscreen_swap_buffers_with_damage (onscreen=onscreen@entry=0x565209b94800, rectangles=0x7ffd81b5d000, n_rectangles=n_rectangles@entry=0)
    at ../cogl/cogl/cogl-onscreen.c:317
#9  0x00007feccd6e74dc in swap_framebuffer (swap_with_damage=0, swap_region=<synthetic pointer>, view=<optimised out>, stage_window=<optimised out>)
    at ../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:503
#10 0x00007feccd6e74dc in clutter_stage_cogl_redraw_view (stage_window=stage_window@entry=0x5652090cd6b0, view=<optimised out>)
    at ../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:954
#11 0x00007feccd6e7c8b in clutter_stage_cogl_redraw (stage_window=0x5652090cd6b0) at ../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:978
#12 0x00007feccd6afcbf in clutter_stage_do_redraw (stage=<optimised out>) at ../clutter/clutter/clutter-stage.c:1345
#13 0x00007feccd6afcbf in _clutter_stage_do_update (stage=<optimised out>) at ../clutter/clutter/clutter-stage.c:1467
#14 0x00007feccd699089 in master_clock_update_stages (master_clock=<optimised out>, stages=0x565209392110 = {...})
    at ../clutter/clutter/clutter-master-clock-default.c:366
#15 0x00007feccd699089 in clutter_clock_dispatch (source=<optimised out>, callback=<optimised out>, user_data=<optimised out>)
    at ../clutter/clutter/clutter-master-clock-default.c:489
#16 0x00007fecce01184d in g_main_dispatch (context=0x565208e4bfa0) at ../../../glib/gmain.c:3179
#17 0x00007fecce01184d in g_main_context_dispatch (context=context@entry=0x565208e4bfa0) at ../../../glib/gmain.c:3844
#18 0x00007fecce011ad0 in g_main_context_iterate (context=0x565208e4bfa0, block=block@entry=1, dispatch=dispatch@entry=1, self=<optimised out>)
    at ../../../glib/gmain.c:3917
#19 0x00007fecce011dc3 in g_main_loop_run (loop=0x56520914c0e0) at ../../../glib/gmain.c:4111
#20 0x00007feccd4c7280 in meta_run () at ../src/core/main.c:676
#21 0x0000565208b4cd85 in main (argc=<optimised out>, argv=<optimised out>) at ../src/main.c:636
```

The backtrace shows libmutter stuck in a `poll()` on the secondary GPU DRM fd.

Presumably this issue could happen on any drivers, not just DisplayLink, but it does require

1. `drmModePageFlip()` to fail arbitrarily, and
1. libmutter to repaint immediately after the failure before idle tasks are dispatched in the main event loop

hence it is probably very rare and might not even be reproducible without a multi-device setup.

These two patches fix two separate causes for the same issue, more details in the commit messages.

The two patches should also be included in the 3.34 branch.

title: x11: Check wacom button flags to determine whether button is mode switch
description:
Checking the leds is not really accurate, since some devices have mode
switch buttons without leds. Check in the button flags whether they are
mode switch buttons for any of ring/ring2/strip/strip2, and return the
appropriate group.

title: polkitAgent: Only set key focus to password entry after opening dialog
description:
Set the key focus to the password field only after we got a request
(and therefore know that a password is requested) instead of using
`setInitialKeyFocus()`. This way we don't try to focus the password
field by default if we aren't showing it (e.g. in case the user has no
password or is using fingerprint login).

Also we have to move the call to `grab_key_focus()` to happen after
`_ensureOpen()`, because otherwise the ModalDialog will set the focus to
one of the buttons while opening itself.

Cherry-picked from commit 70203b58ca5.

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/2066

title: windowManager: Always reset window actors when minimize animation is cancelled
description:
This was left out in b6d47c18c. Fixes an occasional warning:
`this._minimizeWindowOverwritten is not a function`

title: Small PasswordEntry fixes
description: See patches.

title: iconGrid: Fix icon alignment
description:
We don't want the icon to fill extra space, so set the alignment
accordingly. Otherwise we get an unexpected result when adding
a background just to the icon part (as far as I can tell: just
system-action-icon).

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/merge_requests/909

title: st: Fix generated GLSL dependency
description:
StScrollViewFade depends on st-scroll-view-fade-generated.c, but
that dependency isn't expressed to the build system; we just hope
that the custom target runs before compiling the effect.

Instead, add the generated source to the st target so the dependency
is expressed properly.

(The change from .c to .h is to prevent the file from being both
included and compiled, resulting in a duplicated symbol)

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=789937

title: Update default favorite apps list
description:
Many of the apps in the favorite apps list have fallen out of favor.

Replacing Rhythmbox with Music and Shotwell with Photos are obvious
moves. Rhythmbox and Shotwell are not core apps, and that means we
assume they are not installed by default. It doesn't really make sense
to have non-default apps in the apps list.

Evolution is also not a core app, and that is not likely to change, so
it should also be removed. Adding Geary might be more controversial. It
is a strong candidate to become a core app, GNOME Mail, in the near
future, but it is not there yet. So this could arguably be considered
premature. But I figure a GSettings
default is a cheap thing; we can always change it later if desired.

title: keyboard: Stop accessing deprecated actor property
description:
Commit 3d3dca4aa2 turned EmojiPager into a Clutter.Actor subclass,
but one place slipped through that still accesses it through .actor.

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/2060

title: Not having a .js handler is not an error
description:
I don't have an application registered for .js files.  When I run `gnome-extensions create`, it *appears* to do nothing:

```
$ gnome-extensions create --uuid=test --name=test --description=test
$
```

Actually, it has done exactly what it was supposed to do; it has created ~/.local/share/gnome-shell/extensions/test/extension.js .  It just didn't tell me!



This change makes `gnome-extensions create` just print the name of the created file if the user doesn't have an application registered to open .js files.

title: WIP: theme: restructure the SASS and land design fixes
description:
This merge request is two-fold:

## Refactor the SASS

#### 1. Organization and cleanup

- rewriting the SASS to be modular–makes editing and finding style definitions for specific parts of the shell easier
   - widgets each get their own scss file in `widgets` which are imported via `_widgets.css`
   - common styles and global values are put in `_common`
- make use of more SASS variables so there's fewer values to track; new variables for:
   - border radii
   - padding, spacing and margins
   - uncommon colors
- nest classes as much as possible as to mimic it's UI structure
- be consistent with our use of functions
- be consistent with units

#### 2. Support the light variant

- where needed, insert all the needed `$variant == 'light'` styles

#### 3. Iron out some minor visual bugs

- popovers > menus: menuitems padding and borders
- sliders: fixes issues with the borders and legibility of the handle
- keyboard: use buttons draw function for the keys
- keyboard: fix the icon assets canvases and minify
- appgrid: use button drawing for the frequent|all
- overview: use osd styling for the dash and workspace switcher
- search entry: add missing hover styles
- telegraph the media controls better with hover styles

## Land some pure-CSS Design Updates

#### Calendar/Notifications

- consider notifications "buttons" and use that drawing function
- update use of typography
- use the button drawing for the calendar sections
- use larger icons in the notifications

#### Search Results

- draw backgrounds for the search sections to improve legibility of search results, fixes #288

title: Promisify Screenshot.SelectArea and PickPixel
description:
!211 sets out to move the screenshot code to async functions/Promises.

This is mostly straight-forward thanks to `Gio._promisify()`, but `SelectArea` and `PickPixel` need special treatment.

description:

![Screenshot_from_2019-12-19_01-53-01](/uploads/880fd1f8d8b85437d9377d067511d74e/Screenshot_from_2019-12-19_01-53-01.png)

title: Disallow top bar menus without top bar
description:
We got better at tracking a menu's source actor, and now the position is completely off when the source actor isn't mapped.

The most sensible behavior IMHO is to hide menus with their source actor, although I'm probably gonna miss the option of quickly checking notifications when in fullscreen ...

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/2002

title: networkAgent: Handle 'vpn' connections when delaying request
description:
Since commit 90a08ba0b6a, we only open a network secret dialog immediately
in response to user action, and show a notification otherwise.

While for the actual request VPNs are handled separately from other connections,
this isn't true when we show the notification - we need to handle 'vpn' together
with the other types there, or we fall through to the default 'invalid type'
exception.

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/2008 (tentatively)

title: padOsd: Re-query action labels after mode switches
description:
Do this so the pad OSD is able to update dynamically to mode changes,
showing immediately the new actions for the current mode(s).

title: workspace: Pass device to startDrag()
description:
This is necessary to make DnD operations work from tablet devices on
wayland, as it's not the same onscreen pointer sprite than mice. Fixes
window DnD in the overview on tablet devices, no longer having them stick
to the wrong pointer.

title: Folders as dialogs (custom grid, part 3)
description:
Depends on: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/merge_requests/864, https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/merge_requests/880

Makes app folders behave like dialogs instead of popups.

See gnome-session!34

To workaround `Gtk.IconTheme.get_default()` not working in some
situations, expose two common functions for adding search paths to
the GtkIconTheme object used by StTextureCache.

GNOME/gnome-shell#1997

title: screenShield: Adapt to painting and picking API change
description:
This was apparently forgotten in 988a0e7314018, causing the warning:
`JS ERROR: Error: Too few arguments to method Clutter.Actor.paint`

title: switcherPopup: Dismiss when a system modal dialog opens
description:
As system modal dialogs may open without user interaction (for instance
polkit or network agent requests), it is possible for them to pop up
while the app/window switcher is up.

The current result of having both up simultaneously is clearly broken,
so we can either dismiss the popup or prevent the modal dialog from
opening. Assume that the dialog indicates a more important action and
should therefore take precedence, so go with the former.

I'm aware of https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/merge_requests/601, but I'm more comfortable with a more specific `modal-dialog-opened` than a generic `modal-pushed` approach: The assumption that a modal dialog should take precedence over switcher popups is much safer than the assumption that any caller of pushModal() is more important than previous callers.

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1536

title: Stop providing an Access portal backend
description:
A portal review by the design team has concluded that
it is better to have all portals as application-modal
GTK dialogs, instead of mixing them with some system-modal
shell dialogs.

Fixes: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1994

title: Refactor StIcon
description:
Refactor StIcon to improve the code readability, add documentation and add API to set the fallback GIcon instead of only the fallback icon name.

This is the first part of two MRs, where the second MR will refactor StTextureCache to cache ClutterContents instead of ClutterActors.

title: Remove X11-dependency from perf-tool-helper

and the font-size to 18pt, this will make the headings of some dialogs
ellipsize.

See https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1343

title: checkBox: Fix expand and align properties

There's no need for the checkbox StBin to expand, it has fixed width and

This fixes the layout of checkboxes, which broke with
f2bd39b20c89c1896c124f1dccdd587aa544e45c.

title: closeDialog: Fix scale of dialog for x11 clients in Wayland sessions
description:
We missed this case in b6e57a5ae8e3871161e2bdcc44e46af1cc56b2f7,
xwayland clients obviously don't use MetaWindowWayland and thus they
don't apply the double scaling that commit was meant to fix.

title: Some folder improvements
description: This was discussed earlier today in the #gnome-design IRC room. The couple of commits here move the icon grid to where the folder ends up being, either on creation on renaming time.

title: Animate icon positions (custom grid, part 2)
description:
As per design guidance, animate the icons when the grid changes.
Each icon takes 250ms to transition, and starts moving 25ms after
the previous one.

This is how it looks right now:

![icon_grid_animation__for_mr_](/uploads/8d6bba7720da8dfe5bbb7f0d4e92d29f/icon_grid_animation__for_mr_.mp4)

title: keyboard: Fix size of extended keys
description:
Quoting the main commit:

    keyboard: Create extended keys before updating hover state
    
    We want extended keys to have the same size as their parent key,
    but this is currently broken and the keys end up with their
    parent key's preferred size (which is smaller than its allocated
    size).
    
    This is due to the way ClutterActor's width/height properties work,
    which only return the "real" (i.e. allocated) size when the allocation
    is valid, and fall back to the preferred size otherwise.
    
    As changing an StWidget's hover state involves adding or removing
    the `:hover` pseudo class, this is currently always the case.
    Creating the extended keys first means the keyButton's allocation
    is probably valid, so do that.

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1976

title: Remove the Frequent tab (custom grid, part 1)
description:
The Frequent apps grid has a few problems:

 * On a fresh install there would be no history of app usage so the
   applications shown in the grid have no relevance it takes time
   to be useful instead of being useful from the start;

 * The grid has far too many items in it to be relevant; 24 apps is
   well beyond the average use case as most people don't frequently
   use that many, so it gets populated with several apps that are
   single use (hello xterm);

 * The position of items in the grid are always changing based on an
   unknown frequency metric (and not by user-intended input) which
   makes it a poor way to quickly launch apps as one would have to
   constantly learn the positions of the items in the grid;

 * Having two app grids is a bit superfluous and needlessly complicates
   the app launching navigation: you have to spend time checking the
   frequent grid and if it's not there you have to switch over to another
   grid and find the app you need in there it's not straightforward.

Remove the Frequent tab and simplify the related code.

Related: #1425

title: gnome-shell-*.service: survive OOM killer
description:
On Fedora 31, if the OOM killer takes out Firefox, the gnome-shell
immediately dies.

The default for the OOMPolicy setting is "stop", which makes sense for
system services, but certainly not for gnome-shell.

Fixes: #1981

title: gnome-shell-*.service: survive OOM killer
description:
On Fedora 31, if the OOM killer takes out Firefox, the gnome-shell immediately dies:

```
>  Dez 02 20:18:12 kernel: Out of memory: Killed process 2508 (firefox) total-vm:5579204kB, anon-rss:1243628kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:319592kB
>  Dez 02 20:18:12 systemd[1681]: gnome-shell-wayland.service: A process of this unit has been killed by the OOM killer.
...
>  Dez 02 20:18:13 systemd[1681]: gnome-shell-wayland.service: Failed with result 'oom-kill'.
>  Dez 02 20:18:13 systemd[1681]: Stopped GNOME Shell on Wayland.
```

The default for the OOMPolicy setting is "stop", which makes sense for
system services, but certainly not for gnome-shell.

title: extensions-tool: Move to a subproject
description:
Quoting the main commit message:
```
The gnome-extensions tool code is really independent from the rest of the
code base, and could be used either as part of the gnome-shell build or as
stand-alone project (for example for the extension-ci docker image).
    
We can actually support both cases by moving the code to a subproject.
```

This is actually something I came up with when working on #1968, to make it feasible to build an `extension-prefs` flatpak. That bug requires more work though, so here's the same approach applied to `gnome-extensions` to get some feedback whether it's crazy good or crazy bad :smile:

title: Remove broken parsing of @media rules
description:
This code didn't even pay attention to the
cur_stmt->kind.media_rule->media_list, and unconditonally considered
each statement in the ->ruleset to be of kind ruleset.  That seems
broken.

(The theme doesn't use any @media queries, and they are unsupported
anyway.)

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1979

title: WIP: theme: SASS restructuring, theme fixes and design updates
description:
This merge request aims to complete a few goals:

### 1. Improve the structure and organization, by:

- rewriting the SASS to be modular; makes editing and finding style definitions for specific parts of the shell easier
- make use of more SASS variables so there's fewer values to track
- nest classes as much as possible as to mimic it's UI structure

### 2. Include fixes or add support for the dual color variations (i.e. light and dark)

- where needed, insert all the needed `$variant == 'light'` styles

### 3. Iron out some long-standing but minor visual bugs

- popovers > menus: refinements to menuitems' padding and borders
- sliders: fixes issues with the borders and legibility of the handle

### 4. Tackle some of the design goals for the shell that can be achieved in CSS

#### Calendar Redesign

- redesigned Calendar popover
- updated and richer notifications
- general consistency of elements

![Screenshot_from_2019-12-02_12-37-47](/uploads/4a6202a107f594e4b90d545e1bb10287/Screenshot_from_2019-12-02_12-37-47.png)


#### Search Redesign

- background legibility of search results, fixes #288

title: Fix always-true condition
description:
CrCascadePrivate->sheets is a statically-sized array inside the
struct; it can't be NULL.

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/merge_requests/861#note_659216

title: extensionPrefs: Fix opening prefs dialog repeatedly
description:
This is a small issue I stumbled upon while working on #1968.

Quoting the main commit message:
```
extensionPrefs: Always redefine getCurrentExtension() on prefsModule access

We have three interactions with an extension's prefs module:
 - we import the module
 - we call its init() hook
 - we call its buildPrefsWidget() hook

The first two are one-time actions where we expect most getCurrentExtension()
calls (local imports, initTranslations() etc.).

However it's still possible that the extension will use the utility function
in buildPrefsWidget() as well, either directly or via other functions like
getSettings(): Make sure getCurrentExtension() returns the correct extension
in that case, not the last one whose preferences were initialized.
```

title: WIP: New lock screen, part 2
description:
(This depends on https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/merge_requests/864, and thus includes its commits)

Tasks:
 * [x]  Merge screen shield and the unlock dialog

title: switcherPopup: Fix scrollable check
description:
When commit c6cea277e replaced Shell.GenericContainer, the check
whether the required width exceeds the avilable width was changed
from using the minimum widths of items to the natural width of the
scroll view.

That doesn't work correctly, as the *natural* width may well exceed
the actually used width: Namely the width applied by the style can
restrict labels to allocate a smaller width than they would request
unellipsized.

Fix this by using the minimum width of the scroll view's child instead.

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1834

title: altTab: Avoid spurious scrolling arrow in thumbnail list
description:
Sometimes the thumbnail list can show a scrolling arrow despite there
not being anything to scroll. This is due to SwitcherPopup determining
whether to show these arrows by checking if the natural width of the
list is bigger than the allocated width. The allocated width of each
thumbnail box is fixed to 256, but the natural width can exceed this
depending on the length of the title label. Fix this by setting a max
width on the title label.

that the user has stored in the keyring.

These changes allow for the user to remember their password before

An express installation where the user doesn't know the password
can lead to a system where the user is locked out and needs to
rescue the password.

Once the icons make into Gtk, we should drop them from the
data/icons folder.

This is consistent with the mockups available at
https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/blob/master/password-entry/password-entry.png

This doesn't fix #134 yet. We plan to allow for users to peek at
the password from the VM's Properties dialog too.

title: Use the correct logic for vm_map_entry on FreeBSD 13.0-CURRENT >= 1300062 vm_map_entry (Revision 2)
description:
In https://reviews.freebsd.org/D21964, using the vmspace.vm_map.header.right does not give every entry as vmspace.vm_map.header.right is not a new name for vmspace.vm_map.header.next.

Here, we use vm_map_entry_read_succ() and on FreeBSD 12.x and lower, reimplement it here.

Patch credit: Doug Moore of FreeBSD.

title: Use the correct logic for vm_map_entry on FreeBSD 13.0-CURRENT >= 1300062 vm_map_entry
description:
In https://reviews.freebsd.org/D21964, using the vmspace.vm_map.header.right does not give every entry as vmspace.vm_map.header.right is not a new name for vmspace.vm_map.header.next.

Instead, we use vm_map_entry_read_succ() which is the correct logic.

title: Implement our own rect
description:
Marked as WIP, since tests do not pass, but I ran out of time in the weekend and I want to get some feedback.

I know, I know... yet another rect type :)

However I think this sets us up to be more independent from cairo and also to ease a switch to euler. In the mean time it is a net win in terms of code because we already have IRect and so we can easily turn into a generic implementation. It also let's us remove the RectangleExt trait.

One thing I am not super sure of is that since I started with the IRect implementation, the rect is represented as two points rather than origin and size. If you think that is a problem, I think it is easier to do a follow up patch that changes the implementation of `Rect<T>` now that we use it everywhere

title: grltrackerwrapper: Filter content changed to keep only songs
description:
content-changes signal is very verbose:
- it can return multiple notifications for the same resource (one
notification per rdf:type). For example, a song update will trigger
two notifications with the same media id: one associated with
nfo:Audio rdf:type and one with nmm:MusicPiece.
- with the current design of the grilo plugin, it's not possible to
filter the media type (one get notifications for audio, image, and
video).

Both of these changes can be filtered by discarding Grl.Media which
are not audio. Indeed, nfo:Audio changes are not registered as a media
audio.

title: Add logs  from different scanners for testing purposes
description:
The purpose of file list of logs, is to gather informations
about the descriptors of multiple scanners.

# How to use it

If you would like to check the `brightness` minimum and maximum values, you could type:
```
  $ cd data/descriptors
  $ git grep name=\'brightness\'
```
The output of this command will be for example:
```
Canon_LiDE_220.log:[+5,91s] DEBUG: scanner.vala:735: Option 24: name='brightness' title='Brightness' type=int size=4 min=-100, max=100, quant=1 cap=soft-select,soft-detect
Epson_NX300.log:[+58,31s] DEBUG: Option 6: name='brightness' title='Brightness' type=int size=4 min=0, max=0, quant=0 cap=soft-select,soft-detect,inactive
Hewlett-Packard_Officejet_4630_series.log:[+10,75s] DEBUG: scanner.vala:742: Option 6: name='brightness' title='Brightness' type=int size=4 min=0, max=2000, quant=0 cap=soft-select,soft-detect,advanced
````

The first word is the file name (eg. `Canon_LiDE_220.log`), which corresponding to Scanner/Printer model.
You could notice that for `Canon_LiDE_220` the `brightness` range is `-100,100`,
for `Epson_NX300` it is `0,0`, as the descriptor is inactive and for `HP_4630` the range is `0,2000`.

title: Make named crops start at (0,0) instead of in the middle of the scanned page
description:
When a user wants to crop based on a named crop (e.g. A4, A5, Letter, Legal), this is because the source is (presumably) in that format.
Therefore, the probability of the source of the scanned image being nicely aligned to (0,0) is greater than it not being at (0,0) (namely in the middle of the scan).
Without this change, a user who wanted to -for instance- crop to A4 (or Letter, or ...) would have to right-click, select Crop -> A4 and then the cropped area would be in the middle of the scan, chopping off the head of the scanned page and including (at the bottom) empty content.
This change makes named crops originate from (0,0), therefore saving the user the extra step of having to move the location of the (named) crop to that location. This appears to be a much more natural way for the application to behave.
Note that this only applies to named crops.

(This is one of the isolated MRs from [Merge Request 26](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/simple-scan/merge_requests/26))

title: gobject: Handle CONSTRUCT_ONLY flag
description:
CONSTRUCT_ONLY properties are supposed to be only writable during
construction, however this is currently only enforced on the C level.

Add some minimal handling for GObjects defined in JS as well, by
redefining the property as read-only when set from the underlying
C code. We know that call happens only during construction, as
g_object_set_property() and friends handle the flag themselves,
and turning the JS property read-only will prevent changes from
javascript (unless it is explicitly made writable again).

relative and absolute bindir paths).

title: Add overrides for signal matching methods
description:
g_signal_handler_find(), g_signal_handlers_block_matched(),
g_signal_handlers_unblock_matched(), and
g_signal_handlers_disconnect_matched() are all technically
introspectable but don't work in GJS when matching by function, because
when connecting signals we create a GClosure object for each signal
callback. The JS code has no way to search for this object, since it is
private, and additionally there would be no way to match more than one
signal with the same handler connected because they would have different
GClosure objects.

We solve this by storing a pointer to the callable JS object in the data
field of the GClosure so we can search for it. This is normally a bad
idea since bare pointers to GC things may be moved or finalized, but I
believe it's OK here because signal connections are never rooted, always
traced, and the pointer can only be moved or finalized after tracing, so
we can just update or null it out at that point.

We add private C++ methods to ObjectBase/ObjectInstance, and overrides
to GObject.js to call the C++ methods, with API that matches the C API
as much as possible. We do change the mask/optional arguments mechanism
to a more natural properties-object mechanism. We also add convenience
API to match g_signal_handlers_block_by_func() etc., which are macros in
C and so not introspectable at all, but easy to implement here.

Closes: #290

description:
This adds org.gnome.Nautilus.FileOperations2 interface that has same methods with one extra parameter - Parameters that can be used to pass extra data to API. This was last suggestion/idea in https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=758833 bug.

This also adds new `DeleteFiles` method to D-Bus interface to allow delete files not move to trash. File deletion has been requested for desktop icons extension - https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/ShellExtensions/desktop-icons/issues/30 and also for GNOME Flashback desktop icons - https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-flashback/issues/28.

title: search-engine-tracker: Do not lose filename results due to stop words
description:
Tracker uses list of stop words which are not indexed. Consequently,
fts:match doesn't provide any results for such words, which also affects
filenames. I am conviced that this is not crucial issue for content
search, but it is really problem in case of filename search. We should
really always find files regardless of stop words in their names. This
can be fixed on Nautilus side by splitting the search string and using
ftp:match only for content search.

For example, currently it is not possible to find "file-name.txt" file
using "file-n" search string, because "name" is stop word, but it works
nicely with this fix.

Just note that /org/freedesktop/tracker/fts/ignore-stop-words setting
needs to be changed to fix this issue for content search as well.

See the original downstream report:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1646352

title: Fix "security issue in NGINX/php-fpm"
description:
This merge request tries to mitigate an issue documented in [CVE-2019-11043][cve].

I don't know whether this repository is / has ever been used to run a real NGINX web server running Nextcloud, but if it has, I would definitely update the configuration.

According to [Nextcloud's blog entry][blog], the PHP version should be updated to

* **7.1.33**,
* **7.2.24**, or
* **7.3.11**

*(or later)*

And changes similar to this MR should be applied to the configuration.

I couldn't test whether a Nextcloud instance would actually run with this changed configuration.

[blog]: https://nextcloud.com/blog/urgent-security-issue-in-nginx-php-fpm/
[cve]: http://cve.circl.lu/cve/CVE-2019-11043

title: models: Set user_hash if overriding user_skey in Review model
description:
This fixes the `/fetch` API point returning a load of review comments
with differing `user_hash` values (presumably the `user_hash` of the
comment author) and the same `user_skey` value for all review comments
(presumably `_get_user_key($my_user_hash, $the_app_id)`).

In that case, those `user_hash` and `user_skey` values are incompatible:
so when gnome-software later packages them up and sends them in a
request to downvote, upvote or report a review comment, the request is
rejected by the server.

Fix that by ensuring that the `user_hash` is set in the Review model if
the `user_skey` is also being set.

Signed-off-by: Philip Withnall <withnall@endlessm.com>

title: Add libappindicator to stage
<code> blocks syntax highlighting
description:
This is an attempt to fix #24 

This pull requests adds a dependency to the pygments library.

It detects `<code>` blocks, attempts to find the right language lexer based on the `class` attributes. If it fails to find a lexer, then it tries to guess the lexer based on the content. If a lexer is found, then it replaces the content with a syntax-highlighted version, and then add some CSS to style the code blocks.

![gfeeds](/uploads/86641b3f6a2143fa63a72f342fa6a2ac/gfeeds.png)

I hope this do not add to much complexity to the code.

What do you think?

title: add prefix to duplicity to extend the command
description:
## Rationale

Many users, including I, does not have a high bandwidth connection. Thus, Backups processes takes a heavy toll, specially when it is scheduled automatically.

There are some utilities in the Linux ecosystem that can limit the bandwidth for specific processes (such as `Trickle`). However, it requires to launch the process in the following syntax:

```
trickle -s -d 50 -u 50 myprocess
```

## This MR

This MR let the use to specify a prefix to the launched `duplicity` argument line by using `DEJA_DUP_DUPLICITY_PREFIX` which will be prepended as a prefix in the following fashion:

```bash
$DEJA_DUP_DUPLICITY_PREFIX duplicity ...
```

This can be effectively be used with trickle with any parameter or with any other accounting/timeout software.

title: Follow REUSE licensing recommendations
description:

- Drop the single AUTHORS file that was too often out of sync
- Add copyright info to each file individually again
- Use yaml for flatpak dependencies (easier to add metadata to)
- Adds LICENSES dir to hold all project licenses

https://reuse.software/
